result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard A Amacher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard A Amacher

Defendant Richard A Amacher in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1, Judgment to be entered, $705.00 fine/costs, due in 60 days or payment plan, 3 days jail, 3 days sentence credit, sentence is time served, defendant to submit DNA Sample
Filed by Atty Mark Lawton, Bail bond hearing can be removed from the calendar.  He is on a signature bond.

Notice of Hearing Filed 2/2/2016 RE: Bail/Bond Hearing Scheduled for 2/16/16 at 2:30pm Mailed to Richard Amacher Columbia County Jail 403 Jackson St. Portage, WI 53901. Returned at undeliverable. "Return to sender, inmate not here." Per the Columbia County Jail, Mr. Amacher was released 1/26/2016. Message left for Attorney Lawton for clarification.

Defendant Richard A Amacher by video, in custody with attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  $1000.00 signature bond.  No purposeful contact with B.B. or his children.  No violent or abusive contact with E.S. or S.S.  Not to possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  Standard misd. conditions.  Not go on premises where alcohol is sold for on site consumption.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 09:10 am.  Return date scheduled for December 23, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
